Reviews.Title: “Worst Sydney stay ever”
Reviews.Author: hazza55
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Sydney hotels over the years from humble pubs (a category in which I would include this establishment) to five star hotels. This is by far my worst experience in Sydney accommodation. Lets start with what my room didn't have: no wardrobe, no refrigerator, no air conditioning, no television, no tea/coffee making facilities. Basic is your most accurate description of this room - a bed, a chair, an old coffee table, a luggage stand, a ceiling light and fan. Thats it. Oh, and a small rubbish bin sat in the corner near the door. Their were blinds on the windows, thank goodness, otherwise the heat would have made the room uninhabitable. In what at first appeared to be a closet was the smallest, most dilapidated ensuite bathroom I have encountered - and I've seen some shockers in London guesthouses! The ensuite was not very clean either but to be fair it would be a very difficult space to clean given its size and layout. I decided against utilising the soap dispenser and went out and bought my own cake of soap instead. The room was noisy, of course. Well it was on the first floor of a 24 hour pub on the corner of a busy CBD instersection. Mind you that made it handy to the beer tap, slot machines and MacDonalds across the road if the impulse took you at any time throughout the night. As I said there was a ceiling fan in the room, and a cooling southerly change on my first night meant I did manage some sleep. I have no idea how a guest would cope in winter and I'm not going to find out. The best part so far? I was told at check-in that this room was an upgrade! When I mentioned that it was pretty basic I was informed that they had really improved the rooms - "before the rooms were really rough with bedbugs and stuff" said the unhelpful manager who escorted me up to the room. Speaking of staff I found the service in the pub downstairs - I never encountered anyone else, staff or other guests in the accommodation area upstairs - varied between sullen and indifferent. But the manager's behaviour was really bad. Check in was hopeless, involving a lot of time hanging around the bar and slot machines waiting for the manager to finish whatever else he was doing. But if check in was hopeless then leaving this establishment was decidedly worse. I asked the manager when checking out if there was somewhere I could leave my bags as my flight wasn't until the afternoon. He said security could be an issue downstairs - surprisingly he said they had previously had problems with staff! He then said I could leave my bags in the room. I asked, "are you sure, won't you need to have the room cleaned" to which he replied that no it was OK as there were plenty of rooms and no guests. So, off I went about my business and then when I returned briefly at about 11 am my keycard didn't work and the manager asked if I was ready to take my bags. I told him I wasn't and he said then he'd have to charge me for another night if I left them there any longer. I said what about the office downstairs? Nope, no room, can't do it says he although I could see that there clearly was plenty of room. So, that was the parting of the ways between me and the manager who clearly did not know the meaning of hospitality. I've visited over 50 countries, stayed in countless hotels and written quite a few reviews here. I know that this hotel is not a five star property. I've never written a review as critical as this, not even come close, but this place was poor, the hospitality was non-existent and value lousy. I've waited several weeks before writing this review to give me time to get my experience in perspective. I am comfortable with my thoughts on this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “new owners,fantastic location and clean”
Reviews.Author: bowen_11
Reviews.Content: I was reluctanct to stay hear because of past reviews, but when i rang to enquire i was told there was new owners and that they had done a complete revamp.The staff were excellent and very focased on customer service.The room and bathroom were simple but were very clean and comfortable. New beds with fresh, clean linen and nice big fluffy doonas.Location is so convenient and close to all the shops and business district. Looked around and found this place so reasonable in price, would definitely stay again.Congratulations to the new owners!

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't too bed”
Reviews.Author: Dudleigh
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here about this Hotel we wondered what we would find. However we were surprised about the place. Quite a drawn out process checking in, bar staff running round trying to find someone who knew what to do. Got the key, ( and paid $50.00 deposit, which was not mentioned at time of booking) and went upstairs through 3 locked doors. Upstairs is showing great signs of wear and lack of maintence. We had 2 rooms, one twin and one single, both at $80.00 per night each. Rooms are basic, no hand basin or water. Bathrooms, down the hallway, left a bit to be desired. cracked basins, no shower curtains at all. However plenty of hot water and a good supply of water, even if it all finished up all over the floor. At bedtime, beds were comfortabl, and had clean linen on them. Heavy curtains blocked out Street lights, so we slept very well. It could get hot in rooms if weather was hot and sticky. For what we paid, it was acceptable. The location is excellent, Cnr Pitt and Park Streets, very short walk to Town Hall Station. We would stay again if needed to be in centre of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Liken this hotel to a third world place,no power, filthy dirty,smelly infested, keep away.”
Reviews.Author: whalley255060
Reviews.Content: I booked in for 2 nights. I was horrifed as there was no power except for the 2 lights in the ceiling, nil facilities, filthy dirty, smelly and infested. I phoned my son to come and get me. I paid $90 per night for what? I had to stay for one night (5 hours sleeping fully clothed on top of the bed) I should get at least $90 back. Something is very wrong here as the owner must be paying somebody for his licence as this place would not meet the accredition requirements. It is also falsly represented on the web, absolute lies. KEEP FAR FAR AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “The Tramps who sleep in the Park had better accommadation”
Reviews.Author: kevieb
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but I must speak about this place. Do not stay in this dump. It smells, it's noisy, its umcomfortable. It's dirty, It never gets cleaned. They should pay you to stay here. I stayed here on Saturday night at the start of Decemeber 2009. I checked out at 7am just to get out the place. It's like something from an old hitchcock movie. Thank God I didn't catch anything. I was walking though the park on Sunday morning to my business meeting and the poor homeless people who were sleeping rough looked like they had a better night than I did.........never again

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: LeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: Terrible room.Dirty. Appalling place to stay with no service. Service is a dirty word to the staff here. Incredibly noisy. Dangerous area with drunkards everywhere. Bottles broken, screaming, alcohol available downstairs in the pub 24 hours, so no peace and quiet ever. Used as place for drunkards to sleep it off.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - the place is infested!! STAY CLEAR!!”
Reviews.Author: anon749
Reviews.Content: I would advise anyone and everyone to avoid this 'hotel'. On our arrival we had such rude service and had to ask the manager how to get to our room and for help with our bags as there was no lift. The bedsheets on the first night had splatters of blood on them and you could see bugs crawling on the walls, curtains and bed. We later discovered that these were bed bugs and when we asked to change rooms we were taken to 3 different ones as they all had bed bugs. Management were disgusting when it came to dealing with it and even refused to pay for medical expenses after 2 trips to the doctor where the bumps turned out to be SCABIES!! The manager had no sympathy for the situation and was completely rude and dismissive, later even denying that we caught scabies from there. Even the staff there said they wouldn't stay there! STAY AWAY from the Criterion!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Criterion... is that french for CRAP”
Reviews.Author: Jackonowra
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this place 2 years previously with our Brother & Sister in-law and two kids, the room we had had 3 beds and was quite large and reasonably cheap for inner Sydney, so we decided to stay there again. I called and explained that I wanted to book the same room that we had stayed in previously, I also explained the reasons why, they told me this was OK and said â€œsee you in 3 monthsâ€�. When we checked in we were given a different room, much much smaller than the room we booked, a tiny, filthy room with 2 beds and a set of draws. The draws were rotten and had rubbish in them, there were half empty beer bottles on the window sill and the paint was falling from the walls, the carpet was dirty and had a foul smell. Our experience with this hotel was awful this time round, I understand it's at the cheaper end of the scale, after-all we were only sleeping there, but at least they could have cleaned it. They lied to us and wanted to argue with me when I questioned why we didnâ€™t get the room we asked for, I was insulted and called a liar and told there was no such room. We will never stay at this place again and I will tell as many people as I can about our dreadful experience.
